description.narrative: The project objective is to reduce deforestation in the agricultural frontier and to promote sustainable soy production in 6,000,000 ha of the MATOPIBA region.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

comment.narrative:
In the ten municipalities the SICAR has 15,410 properties registered as of (1/12/2016): The following provides number of properties registered in each of the 10 municipalities we are going to work in and the area analyzed so far in percentages of the total area of private lands registered. Area below is in hectares: Palmas - Properties: 877 - Total area: 82,594 - Analyzed: 4,885 (6%) Porto Nacional - Properties: 989 - Area: 216,894 - Analyzed: 17,385 (8%) Monte do Carmo - Properties: 515 - Area: 215,121 - Analyzed: 5,995 (3%) Silvanópolis - Properties: 289 - Area: 77,322 - Analyzed: 7,213 (9%) Santa Rosa - Properties: 288 - Area: 109,372 - Analyzed: 3,721 (4%) Formosa do R.Preto - Properties: 3253 - Area: 1,100,614 - Analyzed: 453,131 (41%) Riachão das Neves - Properties: 1742 - Area: 308,589 - Analyzed: 38,478 (12%) Barreiras - Properties: 2416 - Area: 499,786 - Analyzed: 30,565 (7%) Luis Eduardo Magelhães - Properties: 736 - Area: 296,853 - Analyzed: 14,618 (5%) São Desidério - Properties: 4305 - Area: 1,079,962 - Analyzed 81,562 (8%) Total: Properties: 15,410 - Area: 3,987,107 - Analyzed: 657,553 (16,5%) in 2011
Deforestation rate in Matopiba region (2011) is 7,249km2/year

1) 24,925 properties have been registered (by June 15th, 2020) in SICAR. This exceeds the end-of-project target by about 46%. 2 and 3) Additional 240,000 ha, from 244 properties, were analyzed by November 2020. This result was supported by the training of 20 staff from regulatory agencies in the state of Bahia (INEMA) and Tocantins (Naturatins). Additionally, the project hired two technicians per state to provide assistance on analysis and validations. 3) 1,788.5 ha of degraded soil going through recuperation process with the use of Low Carbon Agricultural practices (LCA), through a partnership with Embrapa. Additionally, 20 farms adopted low carbon agricultural practices, adding up to a total area of almost 60,000.00 ha with LCA practices. 4) Considering all GGP activities’ direct beneficiaries (training & workshops) sum up a total of 7,362: (3,201 female and 4,161 male). This represents 10.8% of the Midterm target level. 5 and 6) Fostering conservation in the region, the project selected over 2,500 ha from 7 areas to receive support on creating local conservation units. Meantime, external factors are continuing to influence the increase of national deforestation rates, and the project areas presented an average deforestation rate of 728.80 km² in the past 7 years. The average deforestation rate in the Cerrado biome for the same period was of 9,095km².

1) 27,124.00 properties have been registered (by June 17th, 2021) in SICAR. This exceeds the end-of-project target by about 59,5%. 2 and 3) Until June 2021, 152 properties in Tocantins and 233 properties in Bahia were analyzed, totaling an estimated area of 333,114,58 hectares in both states. 3) 53 rural producers (on soy and cattle raising) adopting best practices from Low Carbon Agriculture, in partnership with Embrapa. As a result, over 60,000 ha were benefited by the adoption of low carbon technologies in the states of Tocantins and Bahia. 4) Considering all GGP activities’ direct beneficiaries (training & workshops), the total beneficiaries are 22.526, This represents 66.3% of the end of project target. 5 and 6) Continuing the work undertaken on component 3, data quality has been improved in order to better monitor and control conservation in the region. Data sets are available through the platform Radar Sustentabilidade (https://www.radardesustentabilidade.org.br/app), providing information on protected areas, soy expansion risk, degraded landscapes, among others. Although external factors are influencing the increase of national deforestation rates, the average deforestation rate in the project’s 10 municipalities in the previous 8 years felt, reaching 576.78 km² in 2021. Meanwhile, the Cerrado area presented an average deforestation rate of 8,764.43 km².
